name: gi_employ_inc_suburb_2011
title: GI - Working Age Employment and Income (Suburb) 2011

legal.attribution: Government of the Commonwealth of Australia - Australian Bureau of Statistics/{datasource.organisationTitle}, ({dataset.attributionYear}): {dataset.title}; accessed from AURIN on {dateOfAccess}.

legal.additionalInformation: All data/analysis should be attributed to the ABS/Grattan Institute. The data has been published through the Productive Cities report, and may be cited as: Kelly, J-F., Mares, P., Harrison, C., O'Toole, M., Oberklaid, M., Hunter, J., 2012, Productive Cities, Grattan Institute, ISBN:  978-1-925015-32-4.

abstract:
This dataset presents the footprint of statistics related to the employment and income of individuals of 'prime working age' - that is between 25 and 65 years old. This ensures a focus on the segment of the population most likely to be available for employment and excludes most people still engaged in post-school education. The data spans the year of 2011 and is aggregated to State Suburbs (SSC) from the 2011 Australian Standard Geographical Classification (ASGC).

This data has been created by the Grattan Institute for the Productive Cities: opportunity in a changing economy report, Kelly, J-F., Mares, P., Harrison, C., O'Toole, M., Oberklaid, M., Hunter, J., 2012, Productive Cities, Grattan Institute, ISBN: 978-1-925015-32-4.

For more information, please refer to the Productive Cities: opportunity in a changing economy report.
